column4: is there any way to free the memory on ubuntu? sometimes I don have anything running and I have a lot of memory usage
the problem is that sometimes I can't hybernate my laptop because it says that there's not enough memory
how much swap space do you have?
why the heck I can't hybernate my computer because it says there's not enough memory! and I have 1.5G in swap
prolyl because you got alot loaded in memory and swap, and when you hibernate i think everyting in your ram is saved in swap
so how can I hybernate then?
you could try to increase your swap using gparted
but I thought you guys say that 1.5 is fine
are you sure that's gonna solve the problem?
its worth a try atleast or are you low on disk space?
run "top" in a commandline and see wich apps take most memory
but as I said before, sometimes Im not running many programs (like 2) and it says that I don't have enough memory!!
then you got stuff that should be in the swap in the memory
ok so how you clear that?
please talk in a private, easier
